website_summaries.verdict: Sheepskin fabric is soft to the touch but delivers lasting results.
pros: Features breathable mesh backing and soft leather
We love that this glove fits most  hand sizes despite a price point that may suggest otherwise
With proper care, this glove will protect your hands and enhance your racquetball game for the long run
cons: Runs large, so consider going a size down

customer_reviews.title: very good glove, even better value
customer_reviews.text: I play about 12 games per week. I'm 2.5 months in to wearing one of these exclusively and it's played as well and held up as well so far as the other gloves I'd been playing with for the last 5 years which cost $20.00 each, so I'm going to switch to these.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing racquetball for fifty years. During that period I have used every type of glove. I now use these Optima gloves, exclusively. They are the equivalent of brand name gloves costing twice a much. They stretch and conform to the hand well. They are not tacky, but allow for a tight and unyielding grip. They do not get tight and shrink up from moisture. There is an extra layer of leather in the heal of the palm, which helps prevent the gloves from wearing out too quickly. As long as this product is available, I wouldn't even consider buying another manufacturer's glove.
customer_reviews.author: The Bullskinner

customer_reviews.title: Optima Max RH gloves
customer_reviews.text: They fit well for me, I have the XL right hand but I do not think I have that big of a hand. I have probably played around 20 games of doubles with one of these gloves. I have been very happy with how well they have held up. So happy in fact that I bought two more. I have had more expensive gloves that have not held up this well. Update I bought 6 more. I have gotten people that I play racquetball with to buy this glove. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: scottonbike

customer_reviews.title: Best customer service on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: So bought a pair two months ago, loved them, played every day, they ripped from wear. Bought another pair, ripped first day, bought another pair, ripped first day. Now I would usually bash the product but I emailed the seller and they reembersed me two times, unbelievable customer service, I would buy this glove and see if it works for you because you can trust the seller, and the glove is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: these have been great gloves. They stay tacky even when I sweat ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many of these in the past and had found them to run rather large. I normally order a large, so I tried a medium. The medium split as soon as I put it on my hand. Except for the sizing issue, these have been great gloves. They stay tacky even when I sweat in them, and last much longer than higher priced name gloves from Ektelon and Head.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Augustin

customer_reviews.title: Optima Max Grip Cabretta Leather Racquetball Glove
customer_reviews.text: Bought the glove for my wife for Pickleball play; she has sweaty palms. The "mesh" on the back is actually more of a knit fabric (she has an Ektelon glove which has a mesh back). The leather is thick, soft. She washes the glove after every use and the leather has stayed soft. The glove (size small) was a little big, but after the washings, it shrank a little and now fits perfectly. So far, she likes the glove; it does the job of keeping the paddle grip dry.
customer_reviews.author: Honuco

customer_reviews.title: Thick and stretches out
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good racquetball glove if you are a precision player. First (and only) time I used it the leather immediately started to spread out making it feel clunky and slippery. It is thicker than any other glove I have used. I normally use the E force chill, which costs almost three times as much. Was hoping this would be a good replacement but it wasn't. It also runs large. I got a small and it felt like a medium. If you have large hands and don't mind a thick glove this might be ok for you.
customer_reviews.author: mitchoacan

customer_reviews.title: Fit great, gloves last a long time
customer_reviews.text: Fit great, gloves last a long time. A little gentle cleaning every couple of months keeps them fresh. A tiny amount of body oil keeps them pliable. Nothing at all to complain about and the price is right. Demonstrates how overpriced name brands are.
customer_reviews.author: Mike SC

customer_reviews.title: Great glove for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this glove for, at least the last 3 years. I initially used it while playing racquetball. For the last 1.5 years, I have switch to pickleball and using this glove. It very well sticks to your hand and very durable for the price. I used different branded and expensive gloves while playing racquetball in the past. But, once I started using this glove, I stopped looking for any other brand. When I first order this glove, I was a little skeptical as the price was so low compare to other brand's gloves of similar features. Now, I am stuck on this glove and thought I should write my review as well. I highly recommend this glove.
customer_reviews.author: Manoj

customer_reviews.title: Broke (tore) before i even had a chance to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke (tore) before i even had a chance to use it. Pulled onto my hand the first time and it tore between the wrist band and white leather palm material.
customer_reviews.author: Mom+3boyz

customer_reviews.title: it works as good as gloves costing twice as much and actually last ...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many gloves over the years. This Optima glove might not be the most stylish looking glove, but as far as playing goes, it works as good as gloves costing twice as much and actually last as long or longer than some of the expensive gloves. I have had some stitching come undone over time, but only after months of play so I don't feel to upset when I have to replace them. These are well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: K Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves for racquetball. They are a great value for the money. Many other glove choices could be twice as much in cost as these Optima Max Grip gloves. I suspect other gloves that may cost much more may 'breathe' a little better, but these Optima gloves are fine for me. I have several so when one get soaked in sweat I switch to a dry one -- no problem. I also think the gloves are as durable as other much more expensive gloves. The grip is good and this glove is a great value for the money. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a winning kill shot..... splat!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used the glove for the 1st time last week and was impressed with the overall fit and grip it allowed me to have on the racquet. My hands get sweaty fast but I was able to maintain a firm solid grip throughout the match. Now this was the 1st time using so time will be the ultimate test.... stay tuned JMR
customer_reviews.author: JMR

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove. Very well made.
customer_reviews.text: The glove itself is great, it's of the highest quality and I really like it. Very smooth well-made. However I got the XL size because no XXL was offered. The XL is just a tiny bit small for me. I am making do with the glove and enjoying it anyway. But the size issue is why I cannot give it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: WK

customer_reviews.title: good glove - great price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good glove. The sizing is fairly accurate - I have small hands and chose the Medium. A small would have been too small. The leather is still a bit too smooth. I expect it to roughen up a bit and get a little bit better grip from more use. It's a good glove for the budget minded.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: These are great gloves and would be even better if the leather ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great gloves and would be even better if the leather was a little more flexible. One glove of the 6 I purchase was not sewn properly and velcro band came off. I still use that glove. I plan to buy more of these gloves because of the value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove but this is a man's fit not woman
customer_reviews.text: I like the glove but it's a man's fit, the wrist Velcro band is too big for me, to fit I have to fight it to the max and it sticks out The hand fits a little loose too. So I would order a smaller one next time but there is no x small. And believe me I have a big hand for a 5-3 woman 135pds so these are man only if you are a woman it won't fit.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya C Dagenais

customer_reviews.title: Very good glove
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it's supposed to do: provide a good grip. I changed from a Head glove because they seemed to wear out quickly. Time will tell on this, but it is a very good glove and feels like it will last a long time because of the material it's made of. Very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy F. Irving

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves grip well and wear comfortably; overall quality seems high. I have ordered the large and medium sizes and to me they are the same; at least on my hand. I use them for 2-3 games and retaining sweat has not been an issue. They air-dry well hanging on my bag and do not lose shape. I'm sure the much higher priced brand names are better (I'm not sure how), but for the price you can't beat these.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Vic

customer_reviews.title: Buy more than one.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are terrific. My old pricy glove started falling apart so I got two of these: one for my pickleball bag and one for my paddle tennis bag. I sweat a lot and need the glove for paddle stability. These work perfectly. Should have purchased a few more. The vendor is great since they give you a shipping deal for ordering more than one glove.
customer_reviews.author: S. McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: After getting used to the increased thickness of the leather ...
customer_reviews.text: After getting used to the increased thickness of the leather the gloves work well. However, of the last 6 I purchased, 2 ripped out after 3 months while using them playing an avg of 2 games per week.
customer_reviews.author: Tim T

customer_reviews.title: nice glove
customer_reviews.text: solid materials, stitching secure, cabretta leather is substantial. Not sure what the negative reviews are based on, unless they got a defective one. Not a name brand, but it seems solid and the price is right. My old Ektelon Controller glves seem to no longer be available, and were getting pricy. Lets see how these work
customer_reviews.author: the truth

customer_reviews.title: Fits true and takes care of racket slipping
customer_reviews.text: Both my husband and I ordered these gloves to wear for pickleball. Very happy with them. Due to the summer heat the paddle was slipping in my hand and ruining shots. The glove has solved that problem. The glove is lightweight and has a great grip. Fits true to size. Even survived it's first washing ok....
customer_reviews.author: Furgy

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for..
customer_reviews.text: Played with three pair of these, rotate them for longevity. First glove ripped 2 inches at the wrist first night of playing doubles. Second glove ripped an inch at the palm seam my 2nd night of play. Down to one glove in one week. Seemed like a decent risk after reviews, but clearly these have been fudged. Waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rush

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the money paid.
customer_reviews.text: “Good quality for the price. Economical, yet comfortable leather and lasts well for what it costs.” My husband plays racquetball and orders *this* glove whenever he needs one. He doesn’t write reviews, so is dictating and I am passing on his answers.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma29

customer_reviews.title: Truly excellent. I did as suggested and got a size ...
customer_reviews.text: Truly excellent. I did as suggested and got a size smaller and it was perfect. These are 6star items for the price, but even when compared to other gloves and on their own, they merit 5 stars. Comfortable, thick in only the necessary places and just flexible enough. Nice soft leather as well.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: This time I bought the small size. I am not a small person. These gloves run BIG. This small one fits my hand tightly but with enough room for movement. I love it. I am eager to play with it and order more. Medium gloves that I have ordered of this same model fit my hand loosely enough to allow for a cotton liner underneath.
customer_reviews.author: wchjr72

customer_reviews.title: For Pickleball
customer_reviews.text: Bought for cold weather Pickleball play. It does a fine job of keeping the hands warm while providing some dexterity. Bought one for each hand separately.
customer_reviews.author: double0salesman

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good quality, fit good, been using quite a bit and has been holding up really good. Gives a good grip and racquet doesn't seem to slip. Purchased because of the inexpensive price, wanted to try first and then see if I thought I needed an expensive one, but this still serving the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: For the price these are hard to beat. Originally bought 5 and change gloves after almost every game and wear liners too. The original 5 are still in good shape after wearing for several months now but plan on buying 10 more to have extras on hand. I usually wear a small and the Optima small does run a little larger than other brands but wearing the liners help take up any excess space and absorb more sweat.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Durable glove
customer_reviews.text: Holds up as well as can be expected...I wear it for pickleball and it lasts for 2 months...I play 3 times a week for 2 1/2 hours each session.
customer_reviews.author: Pickleball Al

customer_reviews.title: Optima Leather Glove
customer_reviews.text: The glove fits perfectly and is super comfortable. The price point is terrific for the quality of the glove. I purchased two and will purchase more soon. They were delivered on time and on schedule. I recently had hand surgery so I use them for golf, tennis and pickleball; it is definitely a multi-purpose glove.
customer_reviews.author: A. Choy

customer_reviews.title: Great glove
customer_reviews.text: I have used more expensive gloves to play pickleball and have enjoyed wearing this glove. It also help to either clean your old handle or replace the handle grip otherwise the glove will get stained from the old handle.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: Great glove!
customer_reviews.text: Glove works great for racquetball! Excellent product for the $. Doesn't stain your hands like some gloves do. Soft and supple with a great trip. The wrist part is a little loose on me, but doesn't affect performance. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ShireneH

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought these for pickleball. They arrived quickly and fit perfectly. They feel very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sue S.

customer_reviews.title: The glove fit as described and is very comfortable. Usually on my hand the fingers on an ...
customer_reviews.text: The glove fit as described and is very comfortable. Usually on my hand the fingers on an XL glove are to long these were just right. They seem to be well made and will see how they last after playing numerous times.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Healey

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I use this glove for pickleball and I really like it. I had purchased a black glove first but the dye came off on my hand and on my paddle so I got this one to takes its place. It keeps my hand dry and also gives me a good grip on my paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie P12

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves work great!
customer_reviews.text: The price is fantastic and the quality is above average. The fit is just a bit off and my opinion is that it isn't because of sizing wrong, it's just that it feels a little weird. Totally worth it for the price though. I usually use gearbox or pro-kennex gloves which I love, but are quite expensive. Compared to the mainstream name brands, this is definitely not as high end but for the price, this absolutely can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Marc C Perea

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I was taking a gamble to make sure a large would fit my hand and it did with no problem. Compared against others, it's a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: cg3121

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money. These gloves last and last. I use them to play squash now that I've moved to Europe where no one plays racquetball. First pair has lasted a couple years, at least while playing twice a week. Never tore, but stretched out a bit. Just replacing it now.
customer_reviews.author: Are you kidding?

customer_reviews.title: Was decent deal. Was.
customer_reviews.text: This has turned out to be a surprisingly good glove. I always quickly wear out the palm of racquetball gloves but this has held up well. Usually can play for about 50 total hours before palm gives out. EDIT. Price was recently raised by $4 per glove for the standard large size - nearly double what they used to be. Still a reasonable price but still, quite a jump.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Most bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I bought six of them gave two to my buddies. We played for 1.5 hours with no issues with the gloves. I was worried when I first got the gloves the way the leather was stitched around the thumb and palm of the gloves, but they seem to hold just fine. I wear a large glove and most are tight on my hand this one was a little lose so they do tend to run a little big. The main thing was my racquet always felt firm in my hand and I didn't notice any slipping in my grip. I will probably buy 10 more at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Will stiffen a bit after cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: Good price, fits well. Will get wet from lots of sweating. Better to buy at least 2 for alternating while drying. Will dry out stiff after washing with hand soap while wearing. After cleaning, try on and move around to return most of flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Good gloves. I go through gloves pretty fast. These last as long as the more expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: JulioU

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and stylish.
customer_reviews.text: The fit of the glove is perfect. I like the smooth feeling of the palm side of the glove. The only thing I'm not happy with is the fact my white part now partially pink because of the taped wrapped on the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more blisters!
customer_reviews.text: No more blisters! Takes a little while to get used to the feeling of wearing a glove, but is definitely a step above not having a glove at all!
customer_reviews.author: HammocKing

customer_reviews.title: Super poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This glove is garbage! It ripped the whole length of the palm up the seam in the first game. Beware! Junk!
customer_reviews.author: Charles  Masterson

customer_reviews.title: Glove fits and grips
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I purchased this glove...grips my racquet and helps with sweat
customer_reviews.author: RoSa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect glove for pickleball!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect glove for pickleball! I bought several and rotate them. I have somewhat small hands for a man and Medium fits me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: C. Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Guarantied to rot after 2-3 wearings
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and for the first few games they were exceptionally good. After my hand began to sweat the gloves fell apart at the base seam opposite the velcro closure. I can't understand why they can't make a quality product when every other part is pretty good?
customer_reviews.author: Erik H.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best...
customer_reviews.text: The glove is oversized. I am usually a large on python glives or any glove for that matter and this glove is bigger. Also the leather turned stiff after 1 use.
customer_reviews.author: Samsung S20 DTX

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: After the first use stitching started to separate. Good grip on the racquet but really poor quality
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Very thin in the palm, wore hole in it in under 60min.
customer_reviews.text: I use a trigger grip. Wore a hole in the palm within 2 times out playing (and it wasn't my primary glove either time).
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: There is a second layer across the palm, and ...
customer_reviews.text: There is a second layer across the palm, and it loosened up compared to the leather under it. So within 2 games it wasn't usable.
customer_reviews.author: dave aldrich

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit of the Python Vintage Synthetic Racquetball Glove much better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Performs well
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement for a discontinued glove. Hubby plays paddleball and uses several while playing. He gave it a thumbs up so I placed an order for more.
customer_reviews.author: smtgru

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how long it will last but it is more than fine.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Soderberg

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are good, but work better only if you have a rubber grip, do not recommend it if you have the typical manufacturer's grip
customer_reviews.author: Jay Irom

customer_reviews.title: order one size too small
customer_reviews.text: great price good glove but size is way off - order one size smaller than you need - i always get medium and this medium is too large to much trouble to return so will live with them for a year and then order small.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: The glove is really thick and didn't help my sweaty hands hold the racquet well at all.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Like very much, would buy again. Feels and got great.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Heilman

customer_reviews.title: Great glove for racketball
customer_reviews.text: Great glove, unfortunatelu arrive a few days past Christmas and coul not gift it. Seller was amazing addressing my concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Marla

customer_reviews.title: Best performing and best value glove I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: Best performing and best value glove I've ever purchased. I play 3 times a week and this glove is tops. I have both Vision and Python grips and this glove works equally well with them both.
customer_reviews.author: adamsbd4

customer_reviews.title: Good, soft glove
customer_reviews.text: Good glove, comfortable. Have only worn it twice, but so far, it seems to stay soft between wearings. Based on my experience so far, I would definitely purchase this glove again.
customer_reviews.author: Jim P. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Kind of thick compared to my old one
customer_reviews.text: Too thick compared to the other one I was using, it felt weird to use this, hopefully I get use to it
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: I’d buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: This was good for cooler days but too hot in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: “Great Product”
customer_reviews.text: I buy these gloves for a long time for my brother, very good product and at an excellent price. I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Juan A. Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Not the glove I remember.
customer_reviews.text: Not the glove I remember. Separated at the wrist seam as I was putting it on, the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Alaskan

customer_reviews.title: stitching ripped first day
customer_reviews.text: The glove ripped the first day. When pulling the tip of a finger to remove the glove, the base of the finger ripped, separating from the non-leather portion. very unhappy
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Great racquetball glove at this point
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered recently and used last night for first time so I can't speak to how well it will hold up over time, but worked great last night. Here are the pros - Looks nice, comfortable, gives great grip on racquet. At this time I have no negatives. And for sizing I have between large to x large hands and ordered the large and fits perfect for how I wanted it to fit for racquetball.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great glove
customer_reviews.text: I use this glove when I play table tennis. It does a wonderful job.
customer_reviews.author: Dale A. Goff

customer_reviews.title: Tore after x3 wears
customer_reviews.text: Tore after x3 wears. Have been using these in the past and first time defective.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: It was good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Just ok. Used the glove for racquetball and pickleball. It was good while it lasted, but the leather started to wear through pretty quickly. I only play 2-3 hours per week, so it did not see heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: MMW

customer_reviews.title: This are nice looking, on time
customer_reviews.text: This are nice looking, on time, very good service but this pair of glove wont last than a couple of weeks, I will try diferent pair of it,. Some how I feel disappointed because it feel soo good and looks so nice but after couple of weeks it tears aparts,
customer_reviews.author: Jesus V.

customer_reviews.title: durable rating is 1 of 10
customer_reviews.text: lets get real, this thing ripped its seams open at the pinky AND thumb within 30 minutes of first use...HAH what a joke
customer_reviews.author: The Solheims

customer_reviews.title: Great glove for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like the feel of the glove, thickness of the leather, and playability. The sizes tend to run big, so I can easily wear a L instead of a XL, but have used both sizes. For the money, it is a Great glove and rotating 2-3 of them all the time makes them stay in better shape longer, for the price of 1 top brand glove. Keep up the quality !
customer_reviews.author: D. H.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend theses gloves
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend theses gloves. Though, go a size smaller. I ordered large and have now ordered the medium size. Should have read the reviews before I bought the larges. Definitely worth the price and quality! The extra padding on the palm stretches after some use. I cut the patch out and they still are going strong...
customer_reviews.author: MarioM

customer_reviews.title: Great glove for great price
customer_reviews.text: Great glove for Pickleball. Fits well and the leather provides nice contact with the paddle handle. Price of glove is another reason to consider this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Sharon A. Stillman

customer_reviews.title: Really nice for Pickleball
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure what size would be best for me (so got two sizes and both are OK in fit), but the glove is great for pickleball.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Frantz

customer_reviews.title: Best value for money
customer_reviews.text: If you chew through gloves ... there is just no way to get a better value for your money than these. I bought large for my otherwise XL hand and the next time I'll buy mediums. These seem to run larger then synthetics but the grip quality of the leather overcomes my opinion that these might be slightly oversize.
customer_reviews.author: Sotto voce

customer_reviews.title: A good glove, hands down.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, I was glad I made the purchase - for myself and as gifts. I was not embarrassed to give these as a present.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel H. Besalel

customer_reviews.title: Ripped when tried on
customer_reviews.text: Ripped the first time my husband put it on. He never even got to play a game wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Connell

customer_reviews.title: The second one is dong better.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two of them. My husband wore the one three times and it ripped. The second one is dong better.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy C.

customer_reviews.title: I love these for racquetball and sometimes they go on sale ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these for racquetball and sometimes they go on sale for five bucks on amazon and when they do I grab a bunch. The leather is really the standout quality great grip and nice and soft. The velco tab isn't sewn on super solid and it adheres above the wrist which is strange it leaves like a lose cuff where you'd think it would be tight on the wrist kind of hard to explain. Also I need to size down I usually where a med and in these I wear a small comfortably this seems to be consistent in other reviews. Despite these flaws it's still one of my favorite gloves.
customer_reviews.author: M. Merry

customer_reviews.title: These are great gloves, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are great gloves, especially for the price. They have an extra layer on the palm that I'm sure will make them last longer. FYI - They are kinda thick and run a bit large ( XL gloves are usually snug for me but these are slightly loose) but nothing that's a problem. Haven't had them for long so I can say anything about them holding together but so far I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise great gloves, good grip
customer_reviews.text: These gloves seem to be made well - fitment was an issue for me but seller went above normal to accommodate so I'm rating the seller a 4 - I would say the gloves are 3 just because the fitment was so inconsistent. Otherwise great gloves, good grip.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Bone

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Glove For The Price!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t believe how well made and nice this glove is for the little amount I paid. I have used it a bunch since I have gotten and it has held up amazingly. I use it every time I play racquetball which is multiple times a week. Will be ordering more when this one wears out.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bryce Plesnicher

customer_reviews.title: Worst glove ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst glove ever. I used only one time and in the middle of the game was already with a big hole between my fingers
customer_reviews.author: jaime andres pineda

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: It’s an okay glove for the price. Runs a little big.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Mata

customer_reviews.title: Tough
customer_reviews.text: Nice and thin, but more durable than the other brands. Last twice as long. Very pleased it's now available on prime.
customer_reviews.author: John A

customer_reviews.title: Small size glove
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. Keeps hand dry and comfortable. Easy to grip pickleball handle. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This glove came completely apart when I was putting it on the first time. No quality at all. I returned it immediately. (What was left of it.)
customer_reviews.author: Sidney J.

customer_reviews.title: I play a lot and so far these gloves have proven to be great. None of them have shown any wear after ...
customer_reviews.text: Very solid, durable glove. I play a lot and so far these gloves have proven to be great. None of them have shown any wear after 2-3 months use. Phenomenal glove for the price.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: NO GRIP
customer_reviews.text: Worst glove I purchased...no grip. Maybe because i am comparing against a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Anum Zeshan

customer_reviews.title: Little bit tight.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have that big of a hand and the Large is still very snug on me. In golf gloves that I normally get a large is comfortable and plenty big. This seems a tad bit smaller in my opinion. However, it still fits and I've had no issues with the performance of the glove.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality gloves for the price Sizing bigger than expected I ordered a large and medium would have fit like a glove (sorry , couldn't resist) decent quality I will update on durability of glove very pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.author: Jonefed

customer_reviews.title: glove
customer_reviews.text: they never make them In my sized but this is the best fit so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest glove around
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price if you buy 3 of these verses buy one of the higher end gloves might last about the same amount of time. But if you sweat a lot might not be the best glove for you
customer_reviews.author: Kalae

customer_reviews.title: Good grip
customer_reviews.text: Using this for Pickleball....gives me extra grip in the summer months.
customer_reviews.author: cartecay1

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I play Pickleball several times a week. Fit was great and worked well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Optima Max Grip Cabretta Leather Racquetball Glove
product_meta.description:
Get a grip on your racquet with the Optima Pro racquetball glove. When the game is on the line, you need to feel your racquet and hit your best kill shots. The Optima Pro's ultra-thin Cabretta sheepskin gives you the great feel you need while a breathable mesh backing helps keep your hand dry and cool.

Features:



 * Naturally Tacky
 * Ultra-Thin Cabretta Sheepskin
 * Stay-Soft Leather
 * Reinforced Double Layer Palm
 * Buy 2 or more and save on shipping!
